Best Lululemon Long Sleeve Shirt Moisture-Wicking And Breathable lululemon Lululemon Swiftly Tech Long-Sleeve Shirt 2.0 Pelaez has worn this shirt climbing, snowboarding and mountain biking, and loves it because “it’s the right thickness and breathability to layer or wear on its own,” she says. It fits slim to the body but has elastane in the mix for decent stretch so you can move with ease. And like all Lululemon products, you can get it hemmed for free, which Pelaez did to achieve the proper fit for her short torso. Best Lululemon Hoodie High-Quality, Cozy And Lasts Forever lululemon Lululemon Scuba Oversized Half-Zip Hoodie Perfectly oversized with a slight cropped length, this half-zip hoodie is a bestseller because it blends fashion and function. The fleece material feels soft against the skin, but it’s also breathable so you don’t get stuffy. Best of all, it has a large, wide hood and kangaroo front pocket for added coziness. Best Lululemon Lightweight Jacket Sleek And Slim Fit For Workouts lululemon Lululemon Define Jacket If you’re looking for something sleeker than your average jacket, this versatile, lightweight option is ideal for layering during cooler weather or wearing on its own on mild days. It has a slim fit and stretchy fabric that moves with you, and the thumbholes and long cuffs keep your hands warm. Some reviewers note that they have had theirs for more than 10 years, and it still looks good as new. It comes in two fabric options: Luon (shown above), which is ultra-resilient, and Nulu, which is softer and more delicate. Best Lululemon Jacket For Cold Weather Warmth Without The Bulk lululemon Lululemon Down for It All Jacket Most down jackets are very puffy, but this one is insulated with high-quality, 700-fill-power goose down for superior warmth without the bulk. The stretchy side panels slim down the silhouette and add mobility so you don’t feel like a marshmallow, and the water-repellent exterior is tough enough to handle light rain and snow. Keep in mind, down is not super breathable, so this jacket is best for wearing around town, rather than heart-rate-raising workouts. Best Lululemon Accessory TikTok Famous And Worth The Hype lululemon Lululemon Everywhere Belt Bag Perhaps the most well-worn belt bag of recent times, the Everywhere Belt Bag has become a staple for travelers and city-dwellers that need a convenient way to carry their essentials like a phone, keys and chapstick. You can wear it slung over the shoulder or around your waist, and it has a secure exterior pocket on the back to stash your passport or wallet. Best Lululemon Pants For Men Casual, Sporty And Ready For Anything lululemon Lululemon ABC Classic-Fit Trouser Warpstreme Lululemon’s cult-favorite ABC Pants combine comfort and style. In the signature Warpstreme fabric, they’re breathable, quick-drying and wrinkle-resistant, making them great for work, travel or everyday situations. This style comes in different fabric options and cuts (like classic, relaxed, and slim fits) so you customize it to your liking. This pair also earned the top spot in our review of the best travel pants for men. Best Lululemon Joggers For Men Great For Weekends Or Workouts lululemon Lululemon ABC Jogger Whether you spend your days working from home or want a pair of pants for relaxing after work, these joggers are incredibly comfortable. The sleek, tapered design gives them a modern, athletic look, and the breathable, quick-drying fabric even performs well enough to wear for a short gym session. And while other slim-fit joggers can be pretty tight around the thighs and hips, these offer plenty of room. Best Lululemon Shorts For Men Breathable For Any Activity lululemon Lululemon Pace Breaker Linerless Shorts Dr. Landon Uetz, physical therapist and pickleball instructor on TeachMe.To, wears these breezy shorts during pickleball lessons and PT home visits with clients. “They fit very true, are lightweight, and can be used in a fitness or more casual setting without hesitation,” he says. Choose between 5-, 7-, and 9-inch inseam lengths and lined or linerless versions. Best Lululemon Workout Shirt For Men Anti-Odor Fabric And Breathable Design lululemon Lululemon Metal Vent Tech Long-Sleeve Shirt If you’re looking for a technical long-sleeve shirt, this one is ideal for running and training because of its breathable, odor-resistant fabric and design that accommodates a wide range of motion. According to Uetz, it is a great option for those times you can’t decide between short and long sleeves. And he can vouch for the impressive durability, as he has worn his regularly for nearly five years. Why Trust Forbes Vetted At Forbes Vetted, we provide in-depth, unbiased product reviews to help our readers make informed purchasing decisions. The author of this story, Forbes Vetted contributor Hannah Singleton, frequently covers all things fitness and activewear, so she is well-versed in the technical specs and fabrics that help products perform well. Forbes Vetted deputy editor Kari Molvar, a seasoned fashion editor and longtime runner, provided insight for the product list and edited this story. How We Chose The Best Lululemon Things To Buy We began by researching Lululemon bestsellers and combing through product reviews and customer feedback. As we curated our list, we considered factors like comfort, durability, functionality and technical performance. We also consulted with fitness professionals and avid Lululemon users to get their insights and recommendations on products they swear by. What Is Lululemon Most Known For? Lululemon is most known for its high-quality technical activewear and athleisure, particularly its leggings. Over the past 25 years, the brand has developed a reputation for creating stylish, functional and durable athletic apparel for activities from yoga to running to cross-training. What Are The Most Popular Lululemon Leggings? Lululemon has many leggings but two truly stand out as the best, and are designed for different activities and purposes: The Align leggings are a fan-favorite for low-impact activities like yoga, pilates and lounging. They are incredibly comfortable, making them a popular choice for everyday wear, but lack the durability of Lululemon’s more technical leggings. The Wunder Train, on the other hand, are ideal for high-intensity activities like cross-training, running and weightlifting. These leggings are made with a lightly compressive Everlux fabric, which is breathable, moisture-wicking and quick-drying. What Is Lululemon’s Most Affordable Item? Lululemon is known for their high-end prices, but with these prices come long-lasting and durable products. (Some reviewer and avid users we spoke with have had their leggings and shirts for almost 10 years.) However, if you’re on a budget, you can still find some affordable items at Lululemon. The Everywhere Belt Bag costs less than $50 while their accessories like headbands and socks often ring in under $30. When we sorted their products from low to high price, the Women’s Luxtreme Training Headband was listed for $14 and the Invisiwear Mid-Rise Thong Underwear was $18. Check out my website. Hannah Singleton Editorial Standards Print Reprints & Permissions
news.summary: We sorted through the cult-favorite options and consulted fitness and fashion experts. Here's what made the list of the best things to buy from Lululemon.
news.author: Contributor,Hannah Singleton

news.title: Best Memory Foam Mattress Toppers 2024 - Forbes Vetted
news.text: Share to Facebook Share to Twitter Share to Linkedin Mattress toppers are an inexpensive way to change the way your mattress feels and explore new materials at the same time. The best memory foam mattress toppers, for example, add the signature hugged sensation and impressive pressure relief of the material to your bed with minimal risk. Our top pick overall, the Saatva Graphite Memory Foam Mattress Topper, offers a comfortable contouring feel while remaining breathable and supportive. The best memory foam mattress toppers can upgrade your sleep space without having to replace your ... [+] mattress. Illustration: Forbes / Photo: Retailer Dr. Emily Cleveland of Anderson Orthopaedic Clinic in Virginia suggests a memory foam mattress topper as a way to “test how your body responds to memory foam before committing to an entire mattress.” If you’ve owned your mattress for five years or less and you’re interested in changing the firmness level, adding support or upgrading its cooling ability, a memory foam mattress topper is a great way to go. We researched to find the best memory foam toppers for a variety of concerns and preferences, so you can upgrade your bed for better sleep. Best Memory Foam Mattress Topper Overall: Saatva Graphite Memory Foam Mattress Topper (Queen) Best Affordable Memory Foam Mattress Topper: Linenspa Memory Foam Mattress Topper (Queen) Best Cooling Memory Foam Mattress Topper: Allswell Graphite Memory Foam Mattress Topper (Queen) Best Firm Memory Foam Mattress Topper: Viscosoft Select High-Density Mattress Topper (Queen) Best Memory Foam Mattress Topper For Side Sleepers: Puffy Deluxe Soft Mattress Topper (Queen) Best Memory Foam Topper For Back Pain: GhostBed Memory Foam Topper (Queen) Best Zoned Memory Foam Mattress Topper: Molecule Copperwell Topper (Queen) Best Hybrid Memory Foam Mattress Topper: The Coop Retreat Mattress Topper (Queen) Best Memory Foam Mattress On Amazon: Sleep Innovations Memory Foam Mattress Topper (Queen) Best Memory Foam Mattress Topper Overall Body-Contouring Comfort Meets The Cooling Effects Of Graphite MOST POPULAR Saatva Saatva Graphite Memory Foam Mattress Topper (Queen) Material: Graphite-infused memory foam | Height: 3 inches | Cover: Yes | Warranty: 1 year | Trial: 180 nights Pros: Hugs the body closely without retaining heat Organic cotton cover is breathable and moisture wicking Cons: Cover is spot clean only Limited warranty Saatva produces some of the best mattresses we’ve ever tried, and its mattress toppers are an excellent way to bring the brand’s signature luxury comfort home at a lower cost. The Saatva Graphite Memory Foam Topper is a standout among its line and our pick as the best memory foam mattress topper for most people. It has 3 inches of body-contouring pressure relief, but minus the stifling feel that often accompanies memory foam. An infusion of cooling graphite gel plus an organic cotton cover draw away body heat, making it a suitable option for habitually hot sleepers. Although we'd prefer a machine-washable cover (it's spot-clean only) and a warranty longer than one year, the 180-night at-home trial gives you plenty of time to get acquainted with it. What our writers say: Co-author of this story and Forbes Vetted contributor Alison Barretta writes, “I slept on a Saatva Graphite Memory Foam Mattress Topper during a particularly bad flare-up of my back pain and felt immediate relief after nights of enduring my too-firm mattress. I also tend to sleep warm, but this topper kept me cool at night. While it was comfortable for me as a dominant side sleeper, I found it best for back sleeping as it did an incredible job of distributing my weight in that position. If you have a taller mattress or are only looking for a slight comfort boost, I recommend the 1.5-inch Saatva High-Density Foam Topper, which I’ve also tried. It has a more subtle contouring effect and sleeps relatively cool, but I’d steer chronic overheaters towards the graphite-infused model.” Best Affordable Memory Foam Mattress Topper This Budget-Friendly Topper Is A Hit With Amazon Shoppers Amazon Linenspa Memory Foam Mattress Topper (Queen) Material: Gel-infused memory foam | Height: 2 to 3 inches | Cover: Optional | Warranty: 3 years | Trial: 30 nights Pros: Highly rated Options for thickness, sizes and cover Cons: Some reviewers find it sleeps warm A quality memory foam mattress topper doesn't have to deliver a substantial blow to your wallet—like this model from Linenspa, a consistent Amazon bestseller with more than 87,000 5-star reviews. It’s available with or without a machine-washable cover in a 2- or 3-inch profile. (Opt for the 3-inch version if you crave more sink-in softness.) Linenspa has a broader range of sizes than most of its competitors, so you can enhance a non-traditional size bed or make your RV mattress more inviting. However, despite the inclusion of cooling gel, some customers says this topper sleeps warm, but this could be offset with the right kind of breathable bedding. That drawback aside, this Linenspa mattress topper is a great choice if you want to upgrade your bed on a budget. What the reviews say: Hundreds of shoppers say this Linenspa memory foam topper is “worth the money.” According to one customer, “I didn’t want to spend the money for a whole new mattress so I’m happy I got this mattress topper. My back pain already feels better and it’s honestly so hard to get out of bed because of how comfortable it is.” Another reviewer adds, “My son used this on top of his dorm bed. He said he slept so well on this topper and honestly liked it better than his bed at home.” Best Cooling Memory Foam Mattress Topper This Well-Rated Graphite-Infused Topper Costs Less Than $150 Allswell Allswell Graphite Memory Foam Mattress Topper (Queen) Material: Graphite-infused foam | Height: 3 inches | Cover: No | Warranty: N/A | Trial: 90 nights Pros: Graphite infusion helps minimize heat retention Choice of thickness Cons: Limited sizes available Allswell, a Walmart brand, has made a name for itself by offering affordable mattresses that don’t skimp on quality. For chronic overheaters, its 2- or 3-inch memory foam mattress topper can help cool things down. A layer of graphite-infused Coolflow foam is designed to disperse heat and wick away moisture while you sleep. Starting at just $48 for a twin (before sales), it's a low cost for a cooling topper, although the trade-off is a shorter trial period and no warranty. Still, it's a low-risk investment for anyone seeking relief from night sweats. If you have a little extra money to spend, the Allswell 4-Inch Copper-Infused Memory Foam Mattress Topper has a thicker layer of support with a two-layer design with proprietary Coolflow foam plus open-cell memory foam. What the reviews say: At Allswell, many shoppers say they’d recommend this mattress topper to a friend. According to one customer, “I was hesitant to purchase a foam topper since we've tried it in the past and I was super hot. This one wasn't bad at all...My wife [and I] no longer have a sore back in the morning and I'm not soaked in sweat.” Another review says, “I sleep hot and often wake up sweating, [but] since using this graphite-infused mattress topper I have been much cooler at night and sleeping better.” Best Firm Memory Foam Mattress Topper An Easy, Affordable Way To Add Support To A Soft Mattress Viscosoft Viscosoft Select High-Density Mattress Topper (Queen) Material: Gel-infused memory foam | Height: 3 or 4 inches | Cover: Yes | Warranty: 5 years | Trial: 90 nights Pros: Comes in a wide range of sizes, including less popular options like short queen and short king Pressure relieving and supportive Designed with anchor straps and slip-resistant mesh to keep it in place Cons: No options for firmness Sleeping on a mattress that's too soft can lead to aches and pains in the morning. If your bed has lost its firmness over time, or if your new mattress has more give than you anticipated, adding this medium-firm Viscosoft memory foam mattress topper is an easy comfort upgrade. Available in a 3- or 4-inch profile with a 3.5 pound density, this topper is designed to alleviate pressure on your back and joints while keeping your spine properly aligned. The foam is perforated and infused with gel to promote a cooler night’s sleep. The included bamboo rayon cover is machine washable and has anchor straps for stability and a mesh backing for extra ventilation. A good value, the Viscosoft mattress topper sits comfortably in the mid-range price category and is often on sale. What the reviews say: One Viscosoft customer calls it, “firm yet soft,” adding that they have “no more hip pain...and turning from side to side or back to side is easy because of the firmness.” Another shopper says, “The thickness is just right: firmness to support our back, yet gentle enough to allow us to sleep on our tummy or side just as comfortably. I recommend this topper and will buy it again for our guest room.” Best Memory Foam Mattress Topper For Side Sleepers A Soft Memory Foam Topper With A Lifetime Guarantee Puffy Mattress Puffy Deluxe Soft Mattress Topper (Queen) Material: Memory foam | Height: 2.5 inches | Cover: Yes | Warranty: Lifetime | Trial: 101 nights Pros: Secure fit thanks to deep elasticized sides and anti-slip base Also available in a firmer feel Impressive lifetime warranty Cons: 2.5 inches may not be thick enough for some sleepers Firm mattresses provide excellent support, but if they're too unyielding they can exert pressure on your joints, resulting in discomfort or pain while side sleeping. If that sounds like your current sleep scenario, consider this soft 2.5-inch memory foam mattress topper from Puffy that offers pressure relief along your hip and shoulder while on your side. It’s wrapped in a lightweight, machine-washable cover made from a blend of bamboo rayon and polyester. The elastic pockets stretch to accommodate mattresses up to 15 inches deep, and a thin layer of gripping material on the bottom of the pad helps prevent shifting if you toss and turn. This mid-priced mattress topper comes with a 101-night at-home trial and a lifetime warranty—the latter of which we typically see included with full-fledged mattresses. A firm version of the Puffy Deluxe Mattress Topper is also available to add support to a softer mattress. What the reviews say: “It is amazing how supportive this extremely soft 2.5-inch topper is,” says a 175-pound side sleeper. “I was able to sleep on my right side for the first time in a long time. Just enough softness to relieve the pressure points before the support is introduced.” Another customer writes, “This is a great option for anyone looking to soften up a mattress that’s too firm. Some toppers are too soft, but this one felt great for my back.” Best Memory Foam Topper For Back Pain Strategically Zoned For Targeted Support GhostBed GhostBed Memory Foam Topper (Queen) Material: Gel-infused memory foam | Height: 3 inches | Cover: Yes | Warranty: 5 years | Trial: N/A Pros: Cooling and contouring to maximize comfort Zoned for more support in high-compression areas Cons: No options for height or firmness No trial window offered This gel-infused memory foam topper is strategically designed to accommodate the body’s natural weight distribution for advanced pressure relief. Peaks and valleys in the foam offer greater support in areas of deeper compression for better spinal alignment, which can help relieve aches and pains. Plus, the varying heights encourage airflow for improved breathability. The 3-inch memory foam topper from GhostBed also comes with a water-resistant fitted cover (removable and washable) and a 2-inch GhostGrip elastic band for a secure fit. GhostBed considers mattress toppers a personal use item, so this one isn’t eligible for a return. There’s no sleep trial, either, but the topper does have a reasonable warranty. What the reviews say: “I have hip bursitis and my husband has back problems,” writes one reviewer. “Sleeping is sometimes not so comfortable for either of us. This topper is such a help in alleviating that discomfort for both of us.” Another says, “The memory foam topper is outstanding. Immediately the first night it felt great. [It’s] very comfortable sleeping in any position. [There’s] no longer any back pain.” Best Zoned Memory Foam Mattress Topper Seven Ergonomic Zones Provide Targeted Relief And Support Molecule Molecule Copperwell Topper (Queen) Material: Copper-infused memory foam ﻿﻿| Height: 3 inches | Cover: No | Warranty: 5 years | Trial: 30 nights Pros: Zoned support works well for areas with deeper compression Cooling copper gel also adds antimicrobial properties Cons: Limited trial window A cover isn’t included A zoned sleep surface can deliver better full-body comfort thanks to different levels of support for different areas of the body. Endorsed by Olympic swimmer Michael Phelps, the Molecule Copperwell is a 3-inch memory foam topper with seven ergonomic zones—three relief areas along the shoulders, hips and knees plus four support areas for the head, waist, legs and feet. An open-cell construction makes for a pliable, breathable surface that contours to your body without overheating. According to the manufacturer, an injection of copper gel adds temperature regulation and antimicrobial properties for a cooler, more sanitary sleep. By design, Molecule doesn’t include a cover so sleepers can experience the full effects of its ergonomic foam. Still, we strongly suggest investing in a mattress protector to safeguard it from stains and spills. Try it risk-free for 30 nights. If you decide to keep it, a 5-year warranty applies. What the reviews say: Feedback is sparse yet overwhelmingly positive for the Molecule Copperwell. One customer says, “This mattress topper helped to relieve severe hip, back and shoulder pain overnight. [It’s] surprisingly comfortable and cooling. [I’m] very pleased with this purchase.” Another reviewer adds, “I have owned this topper for two weeks and have slept without back pain. It is super comfortable and has alleviated all pain for me.” Best Hybrid Memory Foam Mattress Topper A Plush Topper Stuffed With A Memory Foam-Microfiber Fill Coop Sleep Goods The Coop Retreat Mattress Topper (Queen) Material: Cross-cut foam and microfiber | Height: 5 inches | Cover: Yes | Warranty: 5 years | Trial: 100 nights Pros: Lofty and luxurious at 5 inches tall Cross-cut fill boosts breathability Baffle box construction keeps fill evenly distributed Cons: Sizes are limited The cover isn’t removable and the topper is spot clean only If you desire the comfort of a featherbed but require the support of memory foam, the Coop Retreat Mattress Topper is the best of both worlds. Unlike typical foam toppers that consist of a single slab of material, this one is stuffed with a hybrid blend of cross-cut memory foam and microfiber—the same fill used in Coop's popular adjustable pillow. The topper is a lofty 5 inches tall, yielding a lusciously plush feel akin to a luxury hotel bed. It’s encased in a brushed microfiber cover (non-removable) and equipped with corner straps to keep it in place. While sizes are somewhat limited—there's no twin or full option—we like that it comes with a 5-year warranty and a 100-night trial. What the reviews say: One customer says, “I can honestly say it makes a huge difference to my sleep and overall shoulder pain. My shoulder impingement and ‘stuck traps’ seem to have disappeared.” Per another review, “After experiencing the amazing Coop pillows, splurging for this topper was a no-brainer—and it did not disappoint. [I] love the straps on all four corners to keep it secure, the individual pillowy boxes of incredible fluff and the weighty feel. This took our new bed from super comfortable to divine fluffiness.” Best Memory Foam Mattress On Amazon Cooling, Plush Or Enhanced Support—It's Your Choice Amazon Sleep Innovations Memory Foam Mattress Topper (Queen) Material: Gel-infused memory foam, fiberfill | Height: 4 inches | Cover: Yes | Warranty: 10 years | Trial: 30 days Pros: Options for plush, cooling or enhanced support Quilted cover is removable and machine washable Cons: Return window is limited This highly rated topper combines a quilted, fiberfill-stuffed cover with gel-infused memory foam in varying ratios to deliver plush, cooling or enhanced support. That makes it a great pick for a wide variety of sleepers looking to address a range of issues, including pressure relief, overheating or a certain mattress feel. The cover, which is designed like a fitted sheet, keeps the gel foam layer securely in place and it can be removed and machine washed for easy cleaning. This Amazon pick is also made with CertiPUR-US-certified foam and comes in most standard mattress sizes. What the reviews say: “I had no idea how much my body was suffering until I got this mattress topper,” writes one reviewer. “I am sleeping better than I’ve slept in years through the night with minimal tossing and turning in very much decreased pain. It is not too soft. It is not firm. It is absolutely perfection.” MORE FROMFORBES VETTED The Best Things To Buy From Lululemon In 2024, According To Our Review By Hannah Singleton Contributor The Best Walking Shoes For Women, According To Extensive Testing By Kari Molvar Forbes Staff Why Trust Forbes Vetted At Forbes Vetted, we acknowledge the role a good night’s sleep plays in our overall health and the importance of being a discerning consumer. Our quickly expanding library of mattress and bedding stories features detailed product reviews, discussions with trustworthy medical experts and recent developments on ways you can hack your sleep. The author of this article, Alison Barretta, is a Forbes Vetted contributor who’s been professionally reviewing mattresses for three years. She also deals with back pain, which she says is a blessing and a curse, given her profession. Forbes Vetted has several experienced mattress and bedding testers on staff, including senior mattress and sleep editor Bridget Chapman and mattress and sleep editor McKenzie Dillon, both of whom oversaw this article. For additional expert insight, we also consulted with Dr. Emily Cleveland of Anderson Orthopaedic Clinic in Virginia, Dr. Matthew Cavanaugh of Cavanaugh Chiropractic in Louisiana and Dr. Grant Radermacher of Ascent Chiropractic in Wisconsin. Forbes Vetted contributor Jessica Timmons, who has been writing sleep content for well over a decade, updated this piece in May 2024 and added the GhostBed Memory Foam Topper and the Sleep Innovations Memory Foam Mattress Topper from Amazon to the list. How We Chose The Best Memory Foam Mattress Toppers Brand reputation and customer reviews largely influenced our picks for the best memory foam mattress toppers, as did firsthand experience where applicable. Alison Barretta, author of this article, has slept on the Saatva Graphite Memory Foam Mattress Topper. Although she hasn’t tried the Viscosoft, Allswell or Coop toppers featured on the list, her positive experiences with those brands’ other offerings helped inform her choices. We also honed in on memory foam mattress toppers with outstanding features such as ergonomic designs, cooling fibers and removable covers that are easy to wash. We prioritize products that have a warranty and/or a trial period to ease consumers’ minds, especially when buying online. The majority of our picks fall within the mid-range price bracket, but we’ve also included reliable budget-friendly models along with more luxurious offerings so you can find what you need, regardless of budget. What To Consider When Shopping For A Memory Foam Mattress Topper Aside from price—which is understandably important—there are several other factors to consider when purchasing the right memory foam mattress topper for your needs. Thickness Mattress toppers add some height to your bed, so you want to take this into account as you shop and consider fitted sheets and bedding. Memory foam mattress toppers are typically 2 to 4 inches thick, with a handful of options falling outside of that range. Thinner bed toppers are usually more affordable and may be better for you if your mattress is already quite tall. For more cushion and support, seek something thicker. Firmness Just like their full-sized counterparts, memory foam toppers are either soft or firm. “Firmness level is an important feature to consider if you have specific needs such as back or joint pain,” says Cavanaugh. The right topper can help correct the firmness of your current mattress—buying a plush topper is the right move for a mattress that’s too hard, and vice versa. Temperature Regulation Cavanaugh says memory foam is notorious for trapping heat, making it less than ideal for hot sleepers. However, as our list shows, there are memory foam toppers engineered for temperature regulation. Look for foam that’s ventilated and/or infused with cooling elements like gel, graphite or copper, which are known for their heat-conducting properties. If a cover is included, it should be made from a breathable fiber (like cotton) or phase changing materials that are cool to the touch. Also consider the type of bedding you use. Sheets and pillowcases made from materials like cotton, linen or bamboo—as well as specialty cooling sheets designed to wick away heat and moisture—may help mitigate night sweats when sleeping on memory foam. Foam Density Foam density is a characteristic that's often overlooked, but it determines how supportive and responsive your memory foam topper is. Mattress foam density ranges from 0.8 to 6 pounds per cubic foot. According to Radermacher, most people should look for a minimum foam density of at least 3 pounds per cubic foot. “High-density foam won't be the cheapest option,” says Radermacher, but he recommends making it one of your top priorities for optimal comfort. Alternative Materials Mattress toppers come in an array of materials beyond memory foam, and you may find that one made with latex foam, down or a hybrid construction is a better fit. Latex, for example, is a good choice if you’re prone to sleeping hot or don’t like sinking into your bed (provided you don’t have a latex allergy, of course). Unlike memory foam, latex is a naturally breathable material with a more buoyant sensation that lets you feel as if you’re floating on your bed. Its firmer support makes it a good choice for sleepers with back pain. However, latex is often more expensive than synthetic foam, especially if it’s made with certified organic materials. A featherbed creates a softer, plush bed feel akin to what you’d experience at many of the world’s top hotels. It’s a more economical choice compared to memory foam, but there’s less of an emphasis on support so it’s not recommended for sleepers with back or joint pain. Plus, natural down can trigger allergies for some people, although you can find options that trade feathers for synthetic down alternatives. Hybrid mattress toppers combine multiple layers of materials, including foams, latex or down. Some also include a thin layer of micro coils for targeted support. A mattress pad is ideal if you don’t need to completely overhaul the feel of your sleep surface. It’s typically filled with down, wool or a synthetic fiber and adds another 1 to 2 inches to your bed. Most mattress pads are machine washable for easy maintenance and usually cost less than a topper. But if breathing new life into an aging mattress is your goal, a mattress topper, memory foam or otherwise, has a more profound effect. What Is The Highest Rated Memory Foam Topper? It depends where you’re looking, but both the Saatva Graphite Memory Foam Mattress Topper and the Linenspa Memory Foam Mattress Topper are highly rated. In fact, the Linenspa topper has close to 120,000 reviews, and the majority are 5 stars. Do Memory Foam Mattress Toppers Work? A quality memory foam mattress topper can add gentle contouring and pressure relief to your mattress, which can help improve comfort. But memory foam mattress toppers can’t fix a sagging or worn-out bed. If your mattress is no longer offering the support you need, a topper is a short-term fix at best. How Do I Choose A Memory Foam Mattress Topper? Just like choosing a mattress, the best way to choose a memory foam mattress topper is to consider your personal needs and preferences. If you sleep hot, look for gel and graphite infusions that help minimize heat retention. If you want to add a firmer or plusher feel to your bed, find a topper with an appropriate comfort level (and don't forget that body weight plays a big role in how soft or firm a mattress or topper feels). It’s also helpful to factor for your preferred sleep position, a thickness that doesn’t add excessive height to your mattress and price.
news.summary: The best memory foam mattress toppers are an easy and affordable way to upgrade your bed. See our top picks from Saatva, Viscosoft, Allswell and more.
news.author: Alison Barretta,Contributor

news.title: Best Water Filter Pitchers 2024 - Forbes Vetted
news.text: Share to Facebook Share to Twitter Share to Linkedin If you’re looking to improve the quality of your drinking water, a filtered pitcher can yield purer, better-tasting H2O in a matter of minutes. Designed with convenience in mind, the best water filter pitchers reduce a broad range of contaminants, on top of being sleek, easy to refill and pour, and affordable. After testing 14 popular pitchers over the course of a month, the ZeroWater 10-Cup Ready-Pour Pitcher emerged as the clear winner. Certified to reduce lead, chlorine and substances known as “forever chemicals,” the pitcher has an impressive filtration system and produces pure-tasting water. Some of the best water filter pitchers come from Aarke, ZeroWater and Hydros. Illustration: Forbes / Image: Retailers Here are all the winners from my testing process: Best Water Filter Pitcher Overall: ZeroWater 10-Cup Ready-Pour Pitcher Best Value Water Filter Pitcher: Brita Tahoe Water Pitcher Best Upgrade Water Filter Pitcher: Larq Pitcher Purevis Best-Designed Water Filter Pitcher: Aarke Purifier Best Slim Water Filter Pitcher: Pur Plus 7-Cup Pitcher Easiest-To-Pour Water Filter Pitcher: Hydros Glass Slim Pitcher If you don’t have an under-sink water filter, faucet water filter or whole-house system, a pitcher offers the easiest way to improve the quality of your H2O—which is important. “The vast majority of people in the United States likely have some kind of contaminant present in their drinking water that’s above health guidelines, because what is legally allowed in tap water is not necessarily safe,” says Sydney Evans, senior science analyst at the nonprofit Environmental Working Group. To ensure you pick out the right pitcher for your household, consider which contaminants you’re most interested in reducing, as no two filters are the same. It’s also helpful to be familiar with NSF/ANSI Standards, which relate to the reduction of contaminants and particles in water. The most common standards for water filters are NSF/ANSI 42, 53 and 401, each of which pertain to different contaminants: heavy metals, chlorine, emerging contaminants like ibuprofen and more. Then, consider factors such as ease of use, capacity, filtration speed and value. Ahead, here are the best water filter pitchers to improve the taste and quality of your drinking water. Best Water Filter Pitcher Overall Fast And Effective Water Filtration With Great Taste Amazon ZeroWater 10-Cup Ready-Pour Pitcher NSF/ANSI standards: 42, 53 | Reservoir capacity: 10 cups | Filter life: 20 to 40 gallons | Filter replacement cost: $35 (pack of two) Best for: Effectively removing TDS and PFAS Fast filtration speed Clean, pure-tasting water Skip if: You want a pitcher with the longest-lasting filters You want a model that meets standard 401 After extensive testing, the ZeroWater 10-Cup Ready-Pour Pitcher emerged as my top pick, thanks to its quick and strong filtration system and the clean, crisp taste of its water. Featuring five-stage filtration, this pitcher meets the two most important NSF/ANSI standards: 42 and 53, which pertain to “aesthetic” contaminants like chlorine, as well as lead, chromium and PFAS (per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances, nicknamed “forever chemicals”). In fact, in a recent study of 10 pitchers conducted by the Environmental Working Group, ZeroWater’s filter was one of only three options that filtered out PFAS to non-detectable levels. The ZeroWater 10-Cup Ready-Pour Pitcher produced the cleanest-tasting water of all the models I ... [+] tested. Erica Puisis ZerowWater’s biggest claim to fame, though, is that its filters can remove 99.6% of total dissolved solids (TDS), which covers salts, metals, cations and other minerals that can affect water’s taste. When I used a water testing kit to analyze the quality of the pitcher’s filtered water, the results were a string of zeros. The filter also comes with an electronic meter that you can use to take an instant reading of your water’s TDS levels—it’s the best way to track the filter’s life, as there’s no other indicator built in to the pitcher itself. If the meter registers 006, it’s time to swap the filter, per the brand. Aside from the pitcher’s filtering ability, I also appreciated a few aspects of its design: Though it’s not the most sophisticated option out there, it has a quick-fill spigot on the bottom of the reservoir that allows you to dispense ready-to-drink water as the pitcher is filtering, and all the pitcher’s parts are easy to clean. Simply put, I believe you’d be hard-pressed to find a pitcher with a more impressive filter—though the strong filtration system does have one shortcoming. If you have very hard water (as I do), the filter has a relatively short life span. While the brand estimates that each filter should last between 20 and 40 gallons, I had to replace mine after just over a dozen filter cycles. Therefore, if your tap water is high in TDS, keep in mind that you’ll likely need to replace the filter more frequently. To ensure you’re never without a replacement, I recommend setting up an auto-order of the filter multipacks. Best Value Water Filter Pitcher An Easy-To-Fill Option With A Useful Filter Life Indicator Target Brita Tahoe Water Pitcher NSF/ANSI standards: 42, 53, 401 | Reservoir capacity: 10 cups | Filter life: 120 gallons | Filter replacement cost: $20 Best for: Budget-friendly, long-lasting filters Simple cleaning and filling An LED filter-life indicator Skip if: You’re short on space, since the design is bulky You want to more effectively reduce TDS As the longtime leading brand in the water filter space, Brita is a household name—chances are, you’ve enjoyed water from one. During testing, the Brita Tahoe Water Pitcher with Elite Filter proved to be easy to use and effective at filtering out contaminants. It also fills its large 10-cup reservoir in less than four minutes. The pitcher’s design is relatively frills-free, though it’s not the most basic of the brand’s lineup. To help you monitor the filter life, the lid has an LED light that turns on whenever you pour from the filter: When the light turns red, you know it’s time to replace the filter. Fortunately, filter changes are few and far between, especially if you opt for Brita’s Elite filter series. These filters offer more advanced filtration capabilities and a longer life span—they should last for 120 gallons, or about six months of average use. Though this pitcher isn’t the cheapest option out there, it’s nonetheless an incredible value, thanks to its generous capacity and the longevity of its filters. (When buying a pitcher, remember to factor in the cost of replacement filters.) My only gripe is that the filtered water at times had a slightly off taste. I sometimes picked up the taste and odor of chlorine, and when I evaluated the water quality using at-home test strips, the strips confirmed the filter had only a marginal impact on reducing TDS in my water supply. Even still, the filter meets the performance criteria for NSF/ANSI standards 42, 53 and 401, giving you peace of mind that it’s filtering out heavy metals and trace pharmaceuticals. Best Upgrade Water Filter Pitcher A Premium Pick With Smart Features MOST POPULAR Amazon Larq Pitcher Purevis NSF/ANSI standards: 42, 53, 401 | Reservoir capacity: 8 cups | Filter life: 60 gallons | Filter replacement cost: $25, Essential filter; $33, Advanced filter Best for: Preventing bacteria growth with a UV light Tracking your water consumption and filter life with an app Multiple filter options to suit your needs Cleaning in the dishwasher (except for the filter and PureVis Wand) Skip if: You don’t have an iOS device to run the app You want a more budget-friendly pitcher The Larq Pitcher Purevis was the one of the most expensive water filter pitcher I tested—and it was also one of the most impressive. To start, its construction is high-quality and sleek: Available in two colors, the plastic feels thick and durable, while the handle’s rubbery grip provides extra security while pouring. It also has a touch-free fill opening that makes refilling a breeze, and during testing, it took a mere four minutes for the reservoir to fill with filtered water. Lastly, the pitcher—which has two filter options—ranked second for having the best-tasting water, just behind ZeroWater. The Larq pitcher's Purevis Wand uses UVC light to help kill bacteria. Erica Puisis The most unique feature of this pitcher, though, is the Purevis Wand, a rechargeable piece that attaches to the filter and emits a UVC light to eradicate bacteria that might otherwise grow in the moist environment of a water pitcher. While you can activate the light at any time with the press of the button or set it to begin every time you refill the pitcher, it also runs automatically every six hours. To keep tabs on the Wand’s battery (a single charge should last about a month), download the companion app, where you can also track the filter’s life and your household’s water intake. (Unfortunately, there’s no support for Android users at this time.) For those looking to invest in a high-end pitcher, you’ll do no better than the Larq Pitcher Purevis. What’s more, it comes with an Advanced filter, which combats a long list of contaminants covered by NSF/ANSI standards 42, 53 and 401, including PFAS and emerging contaminants like trace pharmaceuticals. If you’d rather opt for a more budget-friendly option, the Essential filter meets NSF/ANSI standards 42 and 53. Both options have an estimated 60-gallon life span. Best-Designed Water Filter Pitcher An Elegant, Sustainability-Minded Glass Option Amazon Aarke Purifier NSF/ANSI standards: N/A; meets EU Standard EN 17093:2018 | Reservoir capacity: 10 cups | Filter life: 31.7 gallons | Filter replacement cost: $20 (pack of three), Pure Filter Granules; $30 (pack of three), Enriched Filter Granules Best for: People who prefer a pitcher made of glass and stainless steel Easy cleaning in the dishwasher Affordable filter refills Skip if: You prefer a pitcher that filters out PFAS Water filter pitchers aren’t exactly known for their good looks, but not all are made from plastic. With a glass carafe and stainless steel components, this dishwasher-safe pitcher from Aarke is sleek and sophisticated. It’s also sustainability-minded: Whereas most pitchers rely on single-use plastic filters, the Aarke purifies water using granules (made of ion exchange resin and activated carbon) that you pour into the stainless steel basket. During testing, I was impressed by this pitcher’s fast filtration speed: It takes about three minutes to process 5 cups, which is the maximum amount you can filter at a time. (The carafe holds 10 cups of water in total.) Though this pitcher doesn’t have NSF/ANSI certifications, both types of its Filter Granules—Pure and Enriched—meet the criteria for EU Standard EN 17093:2018, which addresses performance criteria for water filtration systems. The Pure Filter Granules reduce heavy metals and limescale while improving taste by reducing chlorine levels. The Enriched granules, meanwhile, can do everything the Pure granules can, plus remineralize the water with magnesium and increase the pH to make it more alkaline. Sold in packs of three, both types can filter about 32 gallons. Best Slim Water Filter Pitcher A Basic, Space-Saving Option Amazon Pur Plus 7-Cup Pitcher NSF/ANSI standards: 42, 53, 401 | Reservoir capacity: 7 cups | Filter life: 40 gallons | Filter replacement cost: $11 (Pur Plus) Best for: Small dimensions An LED filter-life indicator light Simple cleanup in the dishwasher Skip if: You want a faster filtering speed You need a reservoir with a larger capacity If your fridge is often short on space, the Pur Plus 7-Cup Pitcher—which is less than 5 inches wide—has a slim build that can fit in even the tightest of spaces. During testing, I was especially impressed by the pitcher’s user-friendly design: It’s easy to maintain a secure grip as you pour, thanks to the rubberized handle, and the thumb lever that opens the fill door on top of the pitcher makes refilling a breeze. Though it does take a while for the water to trickle into the reservoir (during testing, it took 16 minutes for 7 cups), the brand’s Plus filters remove a greater percentage of heavy metals like copper and cadmium than the basic ones. In addition, the Plus filters trap microplastics and other compounds covered by NSF/ANSI standard 401. (Both filters have a 40-gallon life span and are compatible with this pitcher.) And when it comes time to wash the pitcher, the process is a breeze. The lid pops off for easy access to the interior components, and there aren’t any crevices or tight corners that I found challenging to hand-wash. It’s also dishwasher-safe, if you’d rather save yourself the effort. Either way, make sure you snap off the LED filter indicator light from the underside of the lid before you wash the rest. Easiest-To-Pour Water Filter Pitcher A Carafe-Style Pitcher With An Ergonomic Design Amazon Hydros Glass Slim Pitcher NSF/ANSI standards: 42 | Reservoir capacity: 5 cups | Filter life: 40 gallons | Filter replacement cost: $11 (pack of two) Best for: Lightweight, ergonomic design Affordable filter replacement Filtering water as you fill the reservoir Skip if: You want a pitcher that complies with NSF/ANSI standards 53 or 401 You’re looking for a filter-life indicator Let’s be honest: Unless you have extremely strong wrists and forearms, even the most well-designed water pitchers are somewhat difficult to lift and pour. Some are much easier to grip, though, such as the Hydros Glass Slim Pitcher. Designed like a conventional water carafe with a narrow neck you can wrap your hand around, this lightweight model was a breeze to maneuver. During testing, I had zero issue controlling the flow of the water as I poured. Now, it’s worth noting that its filtration system (which uses coconut-shell carbon) leaves something to be desired. While the filters last for 40 gallons and don’t carry a high cost, they’re only compliant with NSF/ANSI standard 42—not 53 or 401. Therefore, if you’re worried about heavy metals, PFAS or trace pharmaceuticals in your drinking water, this pitcher isn’t the best option for your household. For those whose concerns are mainly related to taste and odor, though, this petite 5-cup pitcher has a lot going for it. On top of being easy to lift, it filters water at a rate of about 1 ounce per second, meaning you can refill the entire pitcher in less than one minute. During testing, I found myself keeping the Hydros pitcher on my desk for quick refills throughout the day. MORE FROMFORBES VETTED What To Wear On Vacation: Smart Outfit Ideas From Our Fashion Team By Katherine Louie Forbes Staff The Best Things To Buy From Lululemon In 2024, According To Our Review By Hannah Singleton Contributor Other Water Filter Pitchers I Tested Along with the six winning water filter pitchers, I also tested eight more models that didn’t have the attributes or performance to land in the rankings. Brita Everyday Water Filter Pitcher: The most basic option in the Brita lineup, this water pitcher functions fine and meets the criteria for NSF/ANSI standards 42 and 53. However, the plastic components feel cheap, and there’s no filter-life indicator to easily recognize when it’s time to change the filter. Based on my testing, you’d be better off spending a few more dollars to buy the Brita Tahoe Water Pitcher. Brita Rapids Stream Water Pitcher: I was excited about the convenience of this filter-as-you-pour water pitcher, but it’s practical only for the first glass or two. With less water volume in the pitcher, the stream from the filter slows dramatically, leading you to frequently refill the pitcher to maintain the flow rate. Pur 11-Cup Pitcher: A budget-friendly choice, this water filter pitcher is economical and compatible with Pur’s standard filters or the more advanced Pur Plus filters. It functioned fine in most aspects of testing, but the water had a chlorinated taste, despite meeting the standards for NSF/ANSI standard 42, which addresses chlorine taste and odor. The pitcher’s bulky, dated design doesn’t do much to distinguish it from the competition, either. Aquagear Filter Pitcher: This 10-cup model is equipped with a filter that meets NSF/ANSI standards 42, 53 and 401. It required a few more steps to prep the filter, including flushing the filter for two minutes using an included accessory piece. Although it did produce clean-tasting filtered water, I think there are better options at this price point. LifeStraw Home 7-Cup Glass Water Filter Pitcher: This glass water filter pitcher has a few things going for it, including an appealing aesthetic design and a filtration system that meets a long list of NSF/ANSI standards: 42, 53 and 401. Sadly, it took a long time for the filter to purify the water, making it impractical for everyday use. While LifeStraw acknowledges the filtration speed is slow initially, even after using it for a week, it still took the pitcher 45 minutes or more to fill the pitcher to its 7-cup capacity. Soma 10-Cup Pitcher: The bamboo handle is the most distinguishing feature of this water filter pitcher, which ultimately missed the mark. Notably, Soma’s cone-shaped filtration system generated a lot of noise as the water dripped into the carafe, and it didn’t yield especially great-tasting filtered water. That said, it’s not a bad pitcher: It meets NSF/ANSI standards 42 and 53. I just wish Soma offered a glass carafe version to elevate the overall design. Seychelle Gen 2 Dual pH2O Pure Water Pitcher: This option from Seychelle meets NSF/ANSI standards 42 and 53, plus it claims to raise the pH of your water up to 9.5 to yield more alkaline drinking water. While this pitcher might be able to raise some tap water’s pH by that much, it only increased my house’s H2O from 6.0 to 7.0. Clearly Filtered Water Pitcher: To its credit, the filtration system of this water filter pitcher meets a long list of NSF/ANSI standards: 42, 53, 401 and P473. Several flaws in its design keep me from recommending it, though. For one, it requires the most advanced filter prep of any water pitcher I tested; for example, it requires the use of a “priming bag” that preps the filter media for use. Second, the lid of the pitcher is prone to falling off, which happened to me twice. How I Tested The Best Water Filter Pitchers To determine the best water filter pitchers, I started by identifying the most popular, top-rated models on the market, considering each pitcher’s design as well as the strength and life span of the filters. After eliminating a few models that didn’t meet my criteria for quality, I narrowed down my list to 14 pitchers, which I put through a series of tests over the course of multiple weeks. The winning water filter pitchers from my testing process. Erica Puisis First, I set up each water pitcher following the instructions for prepping and inserting the filter. I noted which filters required presoaking, a purge under the faucet or the use of another accessory to prep the filter. In this phase of testing, I also washed each pitcher by hand, paying attention to how easy it is to reach every nook and cranny of the pitcher’s reservoir, lid and other components. Although some water filter pitchers are dishwasher-safe, I still washed those models by hand in addition to putting them through the dishwasher. Next, I filled each pitcher’s filter compartment and timed how long it took the water to flow into the reservoir. This test helped me identify the efficiency of the models, which is important to some households. Once the initial setup and filter-timing tests were complete, I used each water filter pitcher to fill my glass, top off my water bottle and fill my coffee maker’s water reservoir. I routinely refilled the pitchers and rotated them in and out of the fridge, tasting the water at room temperature and chilled. Because taste is largely subjective, I conducted a blind tasting with three participants to help reduce bias. Since there’s no standard size for water filter pitchers (I tested models with capacities ranging from 40 ounces to 80 ounces), I filtered at least 7 gallons of water through each pitcher over the course of testing. That’s equivalent to how much water one person might filter in two weeks of use, assuming they’re drinking an average of eight 8-ounce glasses of water each day. With each refill, I was looking for signs of slowing filter speeds or changes in water taste or clarity. How To Pick A Water Filter Pitcher All water filter pitchers perform the same basic function: They purify tap water using a cartridge or filter media that traps contaminants, leaving you with cleaner drinking water. That said, not all filters can capture the same contaminants, so it’s important to pay close attention to the NSF/ANSI standards that each filter meets. When shopping, you also want to consider a pitcher’s design, ease of use and capacity, as well as the life and price of replacement filters. Contaminants Filtered While water filters for home use have come a long way since their advent, no single filter can address every contaminant out there. “It’s important to remember that there is no such thing as a perfect filter that removes every single contaminant,” says registered dietitian nutritionist Maya Feller. “People should choose the filter that works for their home as well as budget, and one that filters out the particular contaminants that they want to remove.” Some of the most common contaminants that filters remove are heavy metals like lead and copper, as chlorine. To know which contaminants a filter is capable of reducing or removing, check out which NSF/ANSI standards it’s certified to meet. NSF/ANSI 42: This standard relates to the taste, odor and appearance of the water, otherwise known as “aesthetic claims,” says water filtration expert Rick Andrew. The most common contaminants this standard includes are chlorine, chloramine (disinfectants used to treat tap water) and particulates. NSF/ANSI 53: This standard pertains to the reduction of health-related contaminants like heavy metals, volatile organic compounds (VOCs), and per- and polyfluoroalkyl substances (collectively known as PFAS). “PFAS constitute a group of synthetic chemicals extensively used in industrial and consumer products for several decades,” says Evans. “Renowned for their environmental persistence and resistance to degradation, these compounds, aptly nicknamed ‘forever chemicals,’ have been detected in water supplies globally, prompting concerns regarding potential health ramifications.” NSF/ANSI 401: This standard governs the reduction of emerging and incidental contaminants, like bisphenol A (BPA) and ibuprofen. “These are contaminants that may be present in drinking water at very low concentrations, but consumers are interested in filtering them out anyway,” explains Andrew. Keep in mind that these standards address a wide range of contaminants, and just because a water filtration system meets the requirements for a specific standard doesn’t mean that it reduces every contaminant addressed by the standard. “The NSF standards require that a filtration system must meet the requirements to reduce at least one contaminant,” says Andrew. “They may meet the requirements to reduce more than one contaminant, but only one contaminant reduction is required to conform to the standard.” So if you’re especially concerned about a specific contaminant, research any performance data sheets made available by the manufacturer to better assess the filter’s ability to reduce it. An additional resource worth consulting is the NSF’s Certified Products and Systems database, where you can check whether a filter is NSF-certified. “Certification means that a filter has been third-party tested, meaning it has undergone rigorous testing to standard requirements to verify the product’s claims in line with the standard," says Kyle Postmus, senior business manager for residential water filtration at NSF. Pitcher Design All water filter pitchers have a similar form factor: They have a top-fill function and a spout for pouring. Beyond that, the design can vary pretty significantly. Pitchers can be made of BPA-free plastic or glass, and the capacity can range from 40 to 80 ounces or more. Whether you opt for plastic or glass comes down to personal preference. With capacity, just keep in mind that the larger the pitcher, the more unwieldy it is to grasp. If you suffer from arm or wrist mobility or strength issues, it’s probably best to get a pitcher that’s on the smaller side. Filter Life Over time, filters lose their effectiveness as contaminants build up. Therefore, you need to replace the filter from time to time, the frequency of which depends on its life span. Most manufacturers provide an estimate on how many gallons of water each filter can process before replacement is recommended. Just know that the quality of your tap water is a factor. If you have poor-quality tap water and choose a filter that is very effective at removing a wide range of contaminants, for example, the filter life may be considerably shorter than what it would be with tap water that is considered to be of average or good quality. In any case, consider buying filters in multipacks, which are typically a better value than single filters. My Expertise I’m a product reviewer and writer with six years’ experience, and I specialize in researching and testing home products and appliances. I often cover topics that relate to measuring and improving quantifiable aspects of your home environment. For Forbes Vetted specifically, I’ve tested and reviewed portable air conditioners, air purifiers and tower fans. My work has also appeared on The Spruce, MyDomaine and U.S. News & World Report. It’s also important to note that I’ve long been concerned about the quality of the tap water in my Florida home, where I can’t install a whole-house filter system or under-sink option, so I was eager to challenge top pitchers to purify my drinking water. Along with conducting hours of research into water quality standards, filter media and the purpose (and limitations) of water filter pitchers, I consulted several experts to get their input on what to look for in these vessels. Rick Andrew, a consultant on drinking water treatment certification strategies and a voting member of the NSF Joint Committee on Drinking Water Treatment Units, explained the most pertinent NSF/ANSI standards for water filtration devices. Then, Sydney Evans, senior science analyst at the Environmental Working Group, weighed in on the growing concern over PFAS, also known as “forever chemicals,” which are found in everything from furniture to cosmetics to drinking water. Kyle Postmus, the senior business manager for residential water filtration at NSF, provided information on how consumers can verify NSF certification for water filters. Lastly, registered dietitian nutritionist Maya Feller of Brooklyn-based Maya Feller Nutrition provided some context on how to know which contaminants to prioritize when comparing water filter pitchers. What Are The Benefits Of A Water Filter Pitcher? A water filter pitcher makes it easy to drink pure, clean-tasting water at home. While faucet-mounted filters and under-the-sink purification systems have the edge over filtered pitchers in terms of reducing contaminants, the latter are certainly more convenient, as no installation is required. Whenever you want cold, filtered water, all you have to do is reach into the fridge and grab the pitcher. (That is, as long as no one in your household has neglected to refill the water reservoir.) With one of the best water filter pitchers, you can feel good about the quality of your H2O: Many filter a wide range of contaminants, including heavy metals (lead, copper, mercury and others), PFAS, trace pharmaceuticals and by-products of disinfectants. How Do You Clean A Water Filter Pitcher? Because each pitcher has a unique construction, it’s best to follow the manufacturer’s instructions for care and cleaning. While some filters are dishwasher-safe, hand-washing with dish soap and a soft sponge is often the wisest approach. Whatever you do, make sure you don’t wash the filter media, which will render it unusable. For more detailed instructions, check out this guide to cleaning a water filter pitcher. How Often Does The Filter Need To Be Replaced? To function effectively, a pitcher’s filter needs to be replaced periodically. How often this needs to be done depends on two main factors: the longevity of the filter and the starting quality of your tap water. Some filters need to be replaced as often as every 20 to 40 gallons, while others can last for 100 gallons or more. So, let’s say you drink eight 8-ounce glasses of water per day—that’s a half gallon of water. If you live with another person who drinks a comparable amount, you should expect to replace the filter every one to three months. But remember, if your tap water has a lot of impurities, you might end up replacing the filter more frequently. Erica Puisis Editorial Standards Print Reprints & Permissions
news.summary: The best water filter pitchers reduce a broad range of contaminants, on top of being sleek, easy to refill and pour, and affordable. Here are our top picks.
news.author: Contributor,Erica Puisis

news.title: Best Tumblers 2024 - Forbes Vetted
news.text: Share to Facebook Share to Twitter Share to Linkedin Whether you're aiming to boost your daily hydration or you're constantly on the go, a tumbler serves as a stylish, portable and reusable vessel for your cold drinks. The best tumblers are insulated to maintain the chill of your beverage and prevent leaks and spills. Moreover, they provide a pleasant drinking experience, whether through a spout or a straw, and are easy to keep clean. Our top pick is the Owala Stainless Steel Travel Tumbler, a stainless steel tumbler with a splash-resistant lid that offers two convenient modes for drinking. The best tumblers offer a stylish, portable and reusable vessel for your drinks. ILLUSTRATION: FORBES / PHOTOS: RETAILERS Considering the space a tumbler can occupy in your cabinet, it’s crucial to keep a few factors in mind as you shop. Look for an option that offers exceptional insulation properties, keeping your beverages at the perfect temperature for hours. Additionally, opt for a tumbler that's splash-proof or leak-proof if you plan on tossing it in your bag for on-the-go use. Lastly, since tumblers can become a haven for mold if not cleaned regularly, prioritize options that are easy to clean. With these factors in mind, here are the best tumblers you can buy right now. Best Tumbler Overall: Owala Stainless Steel Travel Tumbler Best Value Tumbler: Simple Modern Insulated Tumbler Best Tumbler With A Straw: Hydro Flask All Around Travel Tumbler Best Tumbler With A Handle: Stanley IceFlow Stainless Steel Tumbler Best Spill-Proof Tumbler: Brümate Era Tumbler Best Tumbler For Smoothies: Fellow Carter Cold Tumbler The Best Tumbler For Wine: Yeti Wine Tumbler Best Tumbler Overall A Versatile, Splash-Resistant Tumbler For On-The-Go Hydration Owala Owala Stainless Steel Travel Tumbler Material: Stainless steel | Capacity: 40 ounces | Weight: 1.6 pounds | Dimensions: 4.37 x 12.87 inches | Straw Included: Yes | Insulated: Yes | Dishwasher Safe: Yes Pros: Excellent temperature retention Splash-resistant cap Cons: Not completely leak-proof Owala’s tumbler offers the best of all worlds. The stainless steel construction with triple-layer insulation keeps drinks frosty cold for hours without imparting any flavor on your iced coffee, lemonade, sports drink or whatever you have inside. The splash-resistant lid offers two modes for drinking: straw or sip. And despite holding a generous 40 ounces of liquid, it fits most standard cup holders. Best Value Tumbler A High-Quality Yet Affordable Tumbler Amazon Simple Modern Insulated Tumbler Material: Stainless steel | Capacity: 20 ounces | Weight: 8.04 ounces | Dimensions: 3.3 x 6.9 inches | Straw included: No | Insulated: Yes | Dishwasher safe: No Pros: Affordable Leak resistant Cons: Not dishwasher safe For a high-quality, sleek-looking, leak-resistant tumbler that doesn’t break the bank, Simple Modern’s Insulated Tumbler has you covered. The stainless steel tumbler comes in multiple sizes (16, 20, 24 and 28 ounces) to keep you well-hydrated and in more than a dozen colors to match your style and mood. The included straw is both durable and a delight to drink from. Best Tumbler With A Straw A Quality Tumbler With A Durable, Easy-Drinking Straw Hydro Flask Hydro Flask All Around Travel Tumbler Material: Stainless steel | Capacity: 32 ounces | Weight: 1.39 pounds | Dimensions: 5.6 x 11.54 inches | Straw included: Yes | Insulated: Yes | Dishwasher safe: Yes Pros: Excellent temperature retention Spill-resistant Cons: Not completely leak-proof True to its name, you can use Hydro Flask’s All Around Travel Tumbler all the time—for iced coffee, iced tea, cocktails and to keep water cold all day long. The stainless steel cup does not impart any unwanted flavors to drinks and cleans up easily. Despite coming with a straw, the tumbler is remarkably spill-resistant, even when tipped over. Choose from four sizes ranging from 20 to 40 ounces. Best Tumbler With A Handle A top handle that offers a steady grip and fits into cup holders Amazon Stanley IceFlow Stainless Steel Tumbler Material: Stainless steel | Capacity: 20 ounces | Weight: 1.3 pounds | Dimensions: 3.54 x 4.09 x 7.8 inches | Straw included: Flip straw | Insulated: Yes | Dishwasher safe: Yes Pros: Top handle for easy toting Available in many sizes Cons: The stainless steel dents fairly easily The ergonomic, rotating handle on Stanley’s IceFlow Stainless Steel Tumbler sits on top of the bottle, rather than jutting out from the side, allowing you to carry it like a tote and helping it fit in car and stroller cup holders. The tumbler comes in five sizes, ranging from 20 ounces to a whopping 96 ounces for all-day sipping. The double-walled vacuum insulation keeps drinks cold and refreshing for many hours. Best Spill-Proof Tumbler A Solidly Built Leak-Proof Tumbler Brümate Brümate Era Tumbler Material: Stainless steel | Capacity: 40 ounces | Weight: 1.56 pounds | Dimensions: 5.4 x 11.5 inches | Straw included: Yes | Insulated: Yes | Dishwasher safe: Yes Pros: Absolutely leak-proof, even with a straw Cons: Relatively expensive A bit top-heavy Many of the tumblers on this list are leak-resistant, but Brümate takes its leak-proof status extra seriously. The tumbler’s straw-outfitted lid has three modes: open, locked and 100% leakproof—yes, that means even when you shake it, turn it upside down or throw it in your bag for the day. Holding 40 ounces of liquid, it lets you quench your thirst without worrying about spilling iced coffee all over the bottom of your tote or purse. Best Tumbler For Smoothies A Cold Smoothie Companion That's Easy To Sip From Fellow Fellow Carter Cold Tumbler Material: Ceramic-coated stainless steel | Capacity: 16 ounces | Weight: 10.6 ounces | Dimensions: 3.03 x 10.4 inches | Straw included: Yes | Insulated: Yes | Dishwasher safe: Yes Pros: Great size for smoothies Keeps drinks cold Cons: Not fully leak-proof Fellow’s ceramic-coated stainless steel tumbler is perfectly crafted for superior drinking experience. Holding a just-right 16 ounces, it fits the entirety of your mango-banana smoothie or morning protein shake. Plus, the vacuum-insulated stainless steel construction keeps your beverage cold during your workout or when you're on the go. Fellow’s tumbler comes with a splash-resistant screw-top lid and an easy-drinking straw for superior sipping. The Best Tumbler For Wine The Ideal Tumbler For Enjoying Wine Outdoors Amazon Yeti Wine Tumbler Material: Stainless steel | Capacity: 10 ounces | Weight: 8.1 ounces | Dimensions: 3.55 x 4.7 inches | Straw included: No | Insulated: Yes | Dishwasher safe: Yes Pros: Durable construction Sweat-proof on the outside Dishwasher safe Cons: Not leak-proof Whether you're savoring a spicy Malbec at a campsite or enjoying rosé at the beach, Yeti’s stainless steel wine tumbler lets you drink wine al fresco in style. The stainless steel construction features a patented No Sweat design to keep your hands dry and a durable coating that won't crack or peel. The sliding magnet lid is splash-proof, allowing you to drink on the go, but it's not leak-proof, so be cautious about tossing that glass of wine in your bag. MORE FROMFORBES VETTED The 6 Best Water Filter Pitchers, Based On Extensive Testing By Erica Puisis Contributor The 9 Best Memory Foam Mattress Toppers That Offer Contouring Support By Alison Barretta Contributor How We Chose The Best Tumblers To determine the best tumblers, we kept a variety of sizes and price points in mind, in addition to a few other crucial factors. We started by identifying the most popular tumbler brands on the market, such as Stanley, Hydro Flask, Fellow and Yeti, to ensure our picks reflected the market. However, we also made sure to consider lesser-known brands and models that might deserve to be on more people’s radars. In each case, we evaluated the tumbler’s insulation properties, ease of drinking, how splash-proof or leak-proof they were, and how easy they were to clean. In addition to our own assessments, we took into account the feedback from online reviewers as we made our selections. What To Look For In the Best Tumblers Tumblers can occupy considerable space in your kitchen cabinet. Here are a few factors to consider before adding one to your collection. Material And Insulation You can find tumblers crafted in various materials, but all the tumblers on this list are made from stainless steel—and with good reason. Stainless steel is durable and lightweight, usually without imparting unwanted flavors onto drinks. (The Fellow Carter Cold Tumbler is made from ceramic-coated stainless steel for an even cleaner, crisper flavor than uncoated stainless steel.) If you aim to keep drinks cold for an extended period, opt for stainless steel tumblers with double-walled vacuum insulation, such as the Stanley IceFlow Stainless Steel Tumbler. Lid, Straw And Spout Before purchasing a tumbler, it's important to determine your preferred sipping style. Do you prefer drinking directly from the lid or an open cup? Are you fond of a splash-resistant spout that can be tucked away when not in use? Perhaps you only enjoy drinking iced coffee through a straw. Whatever your preference, there's a tumbler to match. In some cases, you can even purchase interchangeable lids for the same tumbler, allowing you to match your lid to your mood. Easy To Clean When you discover a great tumbler, it quickly becomes part of your everyday routine. That means it will frequently get dirty, whether from leftover coffee, smoothies, lemonade or whatever else you fill it with. For easy cleanup, look for a durable, dishwasher-friendly tumbler. If your tumbler comes with a straw, consider investing in an inexpensive cleaning brush to keep the inside sparkling and gunk-free. What is the Best Brand for Tumblers? There are several popular tumbler brands on the market, but perhaps none are as popular as Stanley Tumblers. In recent years, Stanley’s large, handled tumblers, which come equipped with straws, have taken social media by storm. We included a tumbler by Stanley on this list, specifically the Stanley IceFlow Stainless Steel Tumbler, which features a handle on the top for ease of carrying. Additionally, we included tumblers from other leading insulated drinkware brands like Hydro Flask and Yeti. However, our overall favorite was the Owala Stainless Steel Travel Tumbler, which stood out for its durability, excellent insulation and easy cleaning. Ultimately, the best brand for tumblers will vary from person to person and what they're looking for. Nevertheless, any of the tumblers on this list are a reliable choice. Leah Koenig Editorial Standards Print Reprints & Permissions
news.summary: Whether you're aiming to increase your daily hydration or you're constantly on the move, the best tumblers offer a stylish, portable and reusable vessel for your drinks.
news.author: Contributor,Leah Koenig

news.title: Best Latex Mattresses 2024 - Forbes Vetted
news.text: Share to Facebook Share to Twitter Share to Linkedin Gone are the days of choosing between a bouncy innerspring or a body-hugging memory foam mattress with no options to bridge the gap. Now, sleepers have their pick of mattresses, from luxurious hybrids to several types of foam, including latex. The best latex mattresses combine standout features from the innerspring and memory foam worlds to provide support and pressure relief—minus the heat retention. The Avocado Green Mattress, our top pick, not only offers medium-firm comfort, it’s also crafted from quality sustainable materials. After reviewing dozens of latex mattresses, we named the Avocado Green Mattress the best latex ... [+] mattress overall. Illustration: Forbes / Photo: Retailer Latex mattresses vary significantly from one to the next, so we consulted our mattress editors and certified sleep experts to round up the best latex mattresses with high scores across the board. From all-foam to hybrid models, here are the eight best latex mattresses that appeal to different sleepers and budgets. Best Latex Mattress Overall: Avocado Green (Queen) Best Cooling Latex Mattress: Saatva Latex Hybrid (Queen) Best Latex Mattress For Back Pain: Bear Natural Latex Hybrid (Queen) Best Latex Mattress For Combination Sleepers: WinkBeds EcoCloud Hybrid (Queen) Best Latex Mattress For Couples: Awara Natural Hybrid (Queen) Best Mattress For Stomach Sleepers: PlushBeds The Botanical Bliss (Queen) Best Affordable Latex Mattress: EcoSleep Luxe (Queen) Best Latex Mattress For Side Sleepers: Nolah Natural Latex (Queen) Best Latex Mattress Overall A Customer Favorite That's Sustainable And Healthy MOST POPULAR Avocado Avocado Green (Queen) Type: Hybrid | Firmness: Plush, medium or firm | Trial: 365 days | Warranty: 25 years Pros: Generous trial and warranty Three firmness levels Quality latex with multiple certifications Cons: Medium and plush models have an additional charge With an Avocado Green Mattress, you can sleep soundly knowing your bed is made with some of the cleanest and most sustainable natural materials available. The company uses sustainably sourced Dunlop latex from rubber trees that’s processed in GOLS-certified facilities. (Dunlop latex is one of two main types of latex. It’s often considered more affordable to produce and sometimes thought to be more energy efficient than its counterpart, Talalay latex.) The mattress is a hybrid, so it combines the latex foam with a supportive spring base. It’s made with almost entirely organic materials—the wool and cotton blend cover, as well as the latex, are all certified organic by various third-party groups. The mattress is hand-sewn, which eliminates the need for adhesive glue to hold it together. According to the company, adhesives are one source of volatile organic compounds, or VOCs, which can contribute to indoor air pollution. What’s more, this mattress has snagged just about every “free-from” and organic certification possible, including the Global Organic Latex Standard (GOLS) organic latex label, as well as Greenguard Gold and Made Safe certifications. This mattress is also the best overall pick on our list of the best organic mattresses. You can read more about it in our full Avocado Green Mattress review. What the reviews say: “I loved it since day one,” writes a customer. “It has a completely different feeling than a traditional mattress or a memory foam mattress. I sleep on my side, and it’s very comfortable—no body aches, and I sleep longer without a need to keep turning.” Another review notes, “[I] love this mattress. It's super comfortable [and] smells great. And with the pillow top, it feels like a luxurious hotel bed.” Best Cooling Latex Mattress A Breathable Hybrid Mattress With A Heat-Wicking Cover Saatva Saatva Latex Hybrid (Queen) Type: Hybrid | Firmness: Medium-firm | Trial: 365 days | Warranty: Limited lifetime warranty Pros: Free white glove delivery Excellent cooling features Generous trial and warranty Cons: Expensive In general, natural latex tends to sleep cooler and offer more breathability than synthetic substances like memory foam. For people who can’t compromise on cooling, we recommend the Saatva Latex Hybrid. This mattress has a cotton cover that wicks heat away from your body as you sleep. Directly beneath the cover is a 3-inch GOLS-certified organic latex layer that is also vented with airflow channels so your body heat quickly escapes the foam. At its base, the mattress has pocketed innerspring coils that lend a responsive, bouncy feel. What the reviews say: A 5-star review says, “From the moment we laid down on it, we were sold. We sleep soundly and cool. My husband is always h0t natured, but he has no issues with this mattress.” Another adds, “The Latex Hybrid is a side sleeper's delight. I have no more back pain, no pressure point pain and best of all, I no longer feel scalded by my bed if I wake up hot during the night. If I'm too warm, the latex dissipates the heat and gets me back to sleep quickly.” Best Latex Mattress For Back Pain A Vegan Latex Mattress With Ample Lumbar Support Bear Bear Natural Latex Hybrid (Queen) Type: Hybrid | Firmness: Medium-firm | Trial: 120 nights | Warranty: Limited lifetime warranty Pros: Advanced coil system for lumbar support Comes in a ton of mattress sizes Cons: While the company is established, this is a new model launched in 2024 with no reviews If you have back pain, you need a mattress that maintains your spinal alignment throughout the night—a prospect that’s more challenging if you change positions as you sleep. The Bear’s all-natural latex mattress combines a zoned coil system for ample lumbar support with pressure-relieving foam layers. The higher gauge coils are strategically placed in the center of the mattress, where you need the most support. Reinforced coils are also placed along the perimeter to ensure enhanced edge support when lying close to the side and overall integrity of the mattress. Every mattress is engineered and customized at the company's facility in the U.S. The Bear Natural has also gone through a rigorous testing process to be Greenguard Gold Certified for low emissions and it uses Global Organic Textile Standard (GOTS)-certified cotton in the cover, so it's soft to the touch. For cushioning and comfort, the Talalay latex is the star of the show. It provides a unique medium-firm feel without too much bounce or sink. An additional foam comfort layer placed just above the coils is designed to adapt to your body and position and provide additional pressure relief and motion isolation.
